election_record.label: Ohio 1812 Governor

overview.note: Connecticut Gazette (New London, CT) lists Return J. Meigs with 11,856 votes, but correctly lists his majority as 3956.
"Our accounts from Ohio put that state beyond a doubt - Meigs has lost his election and a Clintonian Governor has succeeded." The Vermont Mirror (Middlebury, VT). November 11, 1812.

sub_unit.name: Coshocton
sub_unit.note: The Supporter (Chillicothe, OH), The Western Herald (Steubenville, OH), The Ohio Centinel (Dayton, OH), Liberty Hall (Cincinnati, OH), The Fredonian (Chillicothe, OH), and The Western Star (Lebanon, OH) list Return J. Meigs with 66 votes and Thomas Scott with 22 votes.

sub_unit.name: Fairfield
sub_unit.note: The Fredonian (Chillicothe, OH), The Ohio Centinel (Dayton, OH), The Western Herald (Steubenville, OH), Liberty Hall (Cincinnati, OH), The Western Star (Lebanon, OH) and The Supporter (Chillicothe, OH) list Return J. Meigs with 436 votes and Thomas Scott with 1074 votes.

sub_unit.name: Fayette
sub_unit.note: The Supporter (Chillicothe, OH), Liberty Hall (Cincinnati, OH), The Ohio Centinel (Dayton, OH), The Western Herald (Steubenville, OH), and The Western Star (Lebanon, OH) list Return J. Meigs with 12 votes.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The Liberty Hall (Cincinnati, OH) lists Return J. Meigs with 420 votes.
The Western Star (Lebanon, OH) lists Return J. Meigs with 420 votes and Thomas Scott with 112 votes.

sub_unit.name: Hamilton
sub_unit.note: The Fredonian (Chillicothe, OH), The Ohio Centinel (Dayton, OH), The Western Herald (Steubenville, OH), Liberty Hall (Cincinnati, OH), The Western Star (Lebanon, OH) and The Supporter (Chillicothe, OH) list Thomas Scott with 217 votes.
The Liberty Hall (Cincinnati, OH) lists Meigs with 797 votes.

sub_unit.name: Highland
sub_unit.note: The Western Herald (Steubenville, OH) lists Thomas Scott with 119 votes.

sub_unit.name: Jefferson
sub_unit.note: The Fredonian (Chillicothe, OH) and The Supporter (Chillicothe, OH) list Return J. Meigs with 1046 votes and list no votes for Thomas Scott.
The Western Herald (Steubenville, OH) lists Meigs with 1046 votes and Scott with 411 votes.

sub_unit.name: Miami
sub_unit.note: Liberty Hall (Cincinnati, OH) and The Western Star (Lebanon, OH) list Return J. Meigs with 68 votes.

sub_unit.name: Muskingum
sub_unit.note: The Fredonian (Chillicothe, OH) and The Western Herald (Steubenville, OH) list Return J. Meigs with 684 votes and Thomas Scott with 154 votes.

The Supporter (Chillicothe, OH), The Ohio Centinel (Dayton, OH), The Western Star (Lebanon, OH), and Liberty Hall (Cincinnati, OH) list Return J. Meigs with 625 votes and Thomas Scott with 145 votes. These are the totals without Salt Creek and Clayton townships.

sub_unit.name: Clayton
sub_unit.note: "Returns not yet ascertained... Clayton will give (the republican ticket) a handsome majority." Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH). October 14, 1812.

sub_unit.name: Salt Creek
sub_unit.note: "Returns not yet ascertained, but Salt Creek we learn voted the republican ticket almost unanimously." Muskingum Messenger (Zanesville, OH). October 14, 1812.

sub_unit.name: Ross
sub_unit.note: The Supporter (Chillicothe, OH), The Ohio Centinel (Dayton, OH), The Western Star (Lebanon, OH), and Liberty Hall (Cincinnati, OH) list Return J. Meigs with 677 votes. The Western Herald (Steubenville, OH) lists him with 577.

sub_unit.name: Trumbull
sub_unit.note: The Western Star (Lebanon, OH) lists Return J. Meigs with 660 votes.

election_record.reference: Abstract of Votes, Columbiana County. Western Reserve Historical Society, Cleveland.
